intro: Junellia toninii var. mulinoides, commonly known as the Mulino's junellia, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants, and is characterized by its unique morphological features. The plant typically exhibits herbaceous growth with hairy stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in conservation efforts.
